uncertainty.issue: JWT token expiry time not specified in requirements
uncertainty.context: Implementing authentication middleware for user management API. Security requirements specify JWT authentication but do not define token expiry duration. Industry standards vary from 5 minutes to 24 hours depending on use case.
uncertainty.clarification-requested: What is the required JWT token expiry time for this application? Should we implement refresh tokens for longer session persistence?

options-presented.option: 15 minutes (balanced security and UX, industry standard for sensitive applications)
1 hour (better UX, lower security for sensitive operations)
24 hours (maximum convenience, requires additional security measures)

uncertainty.resolution: Client approved Option B: 15 minutes (900 seconds) with refresh token mechanism for session extension

impact.implementation: Token expiry constant set to 900 seconds in JWT utility module
impact.additional-work: Refresh token endpoint added to implementation plan (Level 3 feature)
impact.documentation: Token lifecycle documented in API specification

uncertainty.context: Implementing user registration endpoint. Security requirements mention "strong passwords" but do not specify minimum length, character requirements, or complexity rules.
uncertainty.clarification-requested: What are the specific password strength requirements? Should we follow NIST guidelines, OWASP recommendations, or custom requirements?

options-presented.option: NIST 800-63B: Minimum 8 characters, no complexity requirements (focus on length and breach checking)
OWASP: Minimum 10 characters, at least 3 of 4 character types (uppercase, lowercase, numbers, special)
Enterprise: Minimum 12 characters with complexity requirements and password history

uncertainty.resolution: Client approved Option A: NIST 800-63B guidelines - minimum 8 characters, no mandatory complexity, implement breach detection via HaveIBeenPwned API

impact.implementation: Password validation updated to NIST guidelines with breach checking
impact.additional-work: Integration with HaveIBeenPwned API for password breach detection
impact.documentation: Password policy documented in user registration API specification
